title: Pakistan national apprehended in Samba | India News - Times of India

text: Pakistan national apprehended in Samba Pakistan national apprehended in Samba The Border Security Force (BSF) has apprehended a Pakistani national while he was crossing the International Border (IB) in Jammu and Kashmir's Samba district, Police said on Sunday. TNN | Updated: Feb 5, 2017, 02.34 PM IST Indian soldier patroling the international border along Line of Control (Photo: AP) NEW DELHI: The Border Security Force (BSF) has apprehended a Pakistani national while he was crossing the International Border (IB) in Jammu and Kashmir 's Samba district, Police said on Sunday. "Security forces nabbed a Pakistan national while he was sneaking into Indian side close to Balhad Post near Basantar River in Ramgarh Sector of Samba ," a senior police officer said "The intruder has been identified as Mansher, 21, son of Mohammad Iqbal. Barring a tennis ball, playing cards and some Pakistan currency notes, no significant recoveries were made from him, who seemed to have crossed into this side of the border inadvertently," the official said. "He is being questioned to ascertain reasons behind the intrusion,"he added. Stay updated on the go with Times of India News App. Click here to download it for your device. RELATED
